active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'In a post-pandemic remote work era, MA-5 Maintenance Personnel requirements are more critical than ever due to nonlocal access risks (MA-4). Provide evidence from NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 and real-world breaches like Equifax.' Encourage participants to reference specific control enhancements.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5. Topic: Maintenance Policy (NIST MA Family). Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Policy Development > Policy Content and Types > Operational Security Policies > Maintenance Policy (NIST MA Family). CRITICAL ACCURACY: ONLY use Rev. 5 MA controls: MA-1 Policy and Procedures, MA-2 Controlled Maintenance, MA-3 Maintenance Tools, MA-4 Nonlocal Maintenance, MA-5 Maintenance Personnel, MA-6 Timely Maintenance Intervention. Exclude MA-7+ (e.g., no vulnerability scanning=RA-5, no removable media=MP). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert array above] - Scaffolding Layers: [insert array above] - Active Learning: Use scenarios from exercises for application cards. - Related: Links to CM/SI/RMF/CSF 2.0 (PR.MA), Equifax case, FISMA. Generate 25 flashcards following this schema exactly: [insert flashcard_schema above]. Output as JSON array: [{'type': '...', 'front': '...', 'back': '...'}]. Ensure pedagogical progression: Start with Layer 1/Remember, end with Layer 4/Create. High engagement: Varied types, misconceptions as distractors.
